artifacts.content:
{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A comprehensive build dashboard that provides visibility, insights, and control over the OLYMPUS product development process.",
    "target_user": "OLYMPUS product team members (engineers, designers, managers) who need to monitor and understand the progress of active builds.",
    "key_differentiator": "The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard consolidates all critical build information in one centralized interface, enabling teams to make data-driven decisions and proactively address issues."
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 10,
        "confidence": 10,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "A list of all active and completed builds, with status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to see a list of all builds in progress and completed, so that I can track the status of the development process."
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 6
      },
      "description": "A visual timeline of the build phases, showing the status of each phase (pending, active, completed, or failed).",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to see a clear visual representation of the build process, so that I can understand the current stage of development and identify any bottlenecks or delays."
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 80,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "A list of all agents involved in the build process, organized by phase, with their current status and task.",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to see who is working on the build and what they are currently doing, so that I can understand the resource allocation and identify any potential bottlenecks."
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 75,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 6
      },
      "description": "A traffic light system that displays the status of key constitutional checks, with explanations for any warnings or violations.",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to see if the build is compliant with the OLYMPUS constitution, so that I can identify and address any potential issues before deployment."
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 70,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "A panel that provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks.",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to understand the rationale behind the decisions made during the build process, so that I can make informed decisions and address any potential issues."
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 65,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 6,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "A collapsible side panel that allows users to ask questions about the current build and receive contextual responses.",
      "user_story": "As an OLYMPUS product team member, I want to be able to ask questions about the current build and get immediate answers, so that I can better understand the process and make more informed decisions."
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status"
      ],
      "milestone": "Comprehensive build monitoring and visibility"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Deeper insights and decision support"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "ongoing",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Collaborative build management"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase (PostgreSQL)"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase for API endpoints and real-time updates",
      "Lucide React for SVG icons"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<2s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive layout on desktop",
      "Core user flows (build monitoring, status checks) completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can complete primary tasks (monitor build, check constitutional status) in under 2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in core flows",
      "Positive user feedback on visibility and insights"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List",
        "description": "A list of all active and completed builds, with status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table of all builds, including active and completed",
          "Each build row shows: build ID, status (queued, running, completed, failed), start time, end time, and duration",
          "Status indicators use appropriate colors (green for completed, yellow for running, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on a build row navigates to the individual build detail view",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches data from /api/builds endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression",
        "description": "A visual timeline of the build phases, showing the status of each phase (pending, active, completed, or failed).",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a horizontal timeline with the following phases: discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment",
          "Each phase shows its status (pending, active, completed, failed) with appropriate color indicators (green, yellow, red)",
          "Phases in progress display a progress bar",
          "Completed phases show start and end timestamps",
          "Failed phases show an error message",
          "Timeline is responsive and scales based on the number of phases"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster",
        "description": "A list of all agents involved in the build process, organized by phase, with their current status and task.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table of all agents, organized by build phase",
          "Each agent row shows: name, role, current status (idle, working, completed, failed), and current task (if working)",
          "Status indicators use appropriate colors (green for completed, yellow for working, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on an agent row expands to show more details about their role and responsibilities",
          "Data fetched from /api/ai/agents endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 80
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status",
        "description": "A traffic light system that displays the status of key constitutional checks, with explanations for any warnings or violations.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a panel with up to 7 constitutional checks, each with a traffic light indicator (green, yellow, red)",
          "Each check shows the article name, status (compliant, warning, violation), and a one-sentence explanation",
          "Checks are fetched from a /api/constitutional-checks endpoint",
          "Traffic light colors match the design constraints (green: #22c55e, yellow: #eab308, red: #ef4444)"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 75
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build",
        "description": "A panel that provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a panel with three sections: 'What was built', 'Why it was built this way', and 'Known risks'",
          "'What was built' lists the generated components and files",
          "'Why it was built this way' explains the key decisions and reasoning behind them",
          "'Known risks' outlines any identified risks and their mitigation status",
          "Data for this panel is fetched from a /api/build-insights endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 70
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": [
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat",
        "description": "A collapsible side panel that allows users to ask questions about the current build and receive contextual responses.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a collapsible side panel with a chat interface",
          "Users can type questions about the current build",
          "Responses are provided based on the build data and insights",
          "Leverages a conversational AI model (e.g., GPT-3) to generate contextual answers",
          "Chat history is persisted and available for the duration of the current build"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 65
      }
    ]
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Complexity of integrating multiple data sources (builds, agents, constitutional checks)",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Implement a centralized data layer that abstracts the API endpoints and provides a unified data model"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Potential performance issues with large build histories and agent rosters",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Implement pagination, lazy loading, and caching strategies to optimize data fetching and rendering"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Ensuring the constitutional status checks are accurate and up-to-date",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Collaborate closely with the ORACLE and EMPATHY teams to define the constitutional checks and their validation criteria"
    }
  ]
}
